Detailed Description

Interface to the Lattice Windows WDM lscpcie2 device driver. The lscpcie2 driver provides the following features:
  • basic read/write access (through PCIe_IF)
  • INTx or MSI interrupt support
  • Common Buffer DMA memory allocation, 16kB w/ read/write access from user space
  • Extra driver information

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

LSCPCIe2_IF::LSCPCIe2_IF (  const char *  pBoardID,
const char *  pDemoID,
uint32_t  devNum = 1
) 
 

Open an interface to the lscpcie2 device driver. The caller must supply the board ID, demo ID (such as the SFIF) and the instance number (which board 1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc) to open.

Parameters:
pBoardID string containing PCI DEV_VEND ID of board to attach to
pDemoID string containing PCI SUBSYS ID describing particular demo IP
devNum instance number of board to attach to (1st, 2nd, ...)

Member Function Documentation

bool LSCPCIe2_IF::getPciDriverExtraInfo (  const ExtraResourceInfo_t **  pExtra  ) 
 

Return the extra device driver information structure. This includes the DMA memory buffer info, PCI bus/dev/func address.

Parameters:
pExtra user's pointer that will point to the internal driver structure
Returns:
true (info obtained in constructor so always present)
Note:
Do not modify the contents of the structure! It is read only.

bool LSCPCIe2_IF::getPCIExtraInfoStr (  string &  outs  ) 
 

Return a string containing additional information (beyond that provided by PCIe_IF) about the driver and device, such as the device bus, function and device numbers, the DMA buffer addresses, etc.

See also:
ExtraResourceInfo_t
Returns:
true if successful; false if error
